sentence.text: Ablation of peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation-3 or fructose 2,6-bisphosphate metabolic process suppresses breast tumour growth in mice and prevents metastasis to the lung from an orthotopic setting, as does Ser857Ala-mutant SRC-3.

fructose 2,6-bisphosphate metabolic process and phosphorylated peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation-3 levels are increased and correlate in oestrogen receptor-positive tumours, whereas, in patients with the basal subtype, PFKFB4 and peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation-3 drive a common protein signature that correlates with the poor survival of patients with breast cancer.

These findings suggest that the Warburg pathway enzyme fructose 2,6-bisphosphate metabolic process acts as a molecular fulcrum that couples sugar metabolism to transcriptional activation by stimulating peptidyl-tyrosine phosphorylation-3 to promote aggressive metastatic tumours
